result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco A Valerio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be served concurrent to any other probation and consecutive to present sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution for Waukesha County Risk Management, as follows:
- for Case 21CM2086, $581.00
- for Case 22CM738, $295.00
- for Case 22CM775, the Court will hold open the restitution request for a period of 60 days and will set a review hearing.
09-16-2022: RESTITUTION FOR CASE 22CM738 AMENDED TO $295.00.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: any of the victims listed in any of the criminal complaints.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, to be used at the Agent's discretion. Agent to determine working or non-working hours.

records.addlTxt:
File not called on the record.
Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Marco A Valerio did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
No further restitution is being requested by the State. Therefore no further action needed on this case.

ADDRESS INFO for Marco A Valerio
Current: PO Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Review hearing on July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Marco A Valerio in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Cases:  21CM2086, 22CM738 and 22CM775 are dismissed as read ins.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty to the charge.

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  any other probation.
Consecutive to:  present sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any of the victims listed in any of the criminal complaints;
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and follow through with any treatment deemed appropriate.

RESTITUTION BREAKDOWN:
$581 - To be paid to Waukesha County Risk Management on case:  21CM2086
$600 - To be paid to Waukesha County Risk Management on case:  22CM738
Court will hold open restitution on case:  22CM775 for a period of 60 days.

COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
60 Days Jail.
STAYED. To be used at the agent's discretion.  Agent to determin working or non-working hours.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
  Review hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's offer as presented by the Defense.

Defendant Marco A Valerio in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on April 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

CONDITIONS MODIFIED 04-04-2022: If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.

09:36 AM Defendant Marco A Valerio in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek appeared by Zoom.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Attorney Kershek states he is not techniquly appointed, but will be appointed this week sometime.
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to prelim hearing time limits.
The Court finds the Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waives his right to have a prelim hearing in time frames.
 Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.
From Atty Kershek regarding appointment.

Filed by Atty. Mark Kershek, requesting to reschedule the Preliminary Hearing on 03-14-2022 at 9:15 am. Sent for review to Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-02-2022.

  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-02-2022 - Due to Marsy's Law, the matter can be changed to status of prelim. using the same date and time provided the defendant waive his invoked 20 day time limit demand in writing. Defendant to be present. Atty. Kershek can appear via Zoom, have someone cover with his calendar or if a mutually agreed upon date is in place, the State and the Court can put that on the record without him being present.**
